item.description: National Heritage Museum is a delightful museum surrounded by pleasant grounds just off Massachusetts Ave near Lexington center. Some exhibits are permanent featuring either Revolutionary War artifacts and the History of American Freemasonry and fraternalism. However, traveling exhibits, lecturer and speakers can be found throughout the year. Museum information 33 Marrett Road (At the intersection of Route 2A and Massachusetts Avenue) 781-861-6559 ext.4100 http://www.monh.org... Free admission and parking Closed Mondays except for selected holidays. A great weekend early afternoon outing followed by late lunch or early dinner in Lexington Center. (especally in Winter)
item.name: The National Heritage Museum in Lexington (by popular request!)
